page.title: 01Harpenden
page.content:
Harpenden is a small town in Hertfordshire in the valley of the River Lea. It is midway between St.Albans and Luton. It has a population of approximately 30,000 people all of whom live in housing which is grouped around the central High Street and the parish church.
There is very little industry in Harpenden it is mainly a residential area with people commuting to larger towns to work. However, Rothamsted Experimental Station does employ 700 people who research into crop growth. Many Harpenden buildings are quite old and the village area is under a preservation order. Harpenden has over two hundred shops, a sports centre, an outdoor swimming pool and many amenities but it retains its green rural atmosphere.
